description: Marianne (pronounced mah-rih-anne) is a discord bot mainly used for server management and simple automation.
commandeAideUtilisation:
The help command allows you to search information about specific commands or modules.
Calling the help command with no arguments will return a list of all modules.
Calling the help command with the name of a module will return the name of all commands in that module.
Calling the help command with the name of a module and the name of a command will return information about the command.
For more help or info you can join this discord server: https://discord.gg/fsW94cN

Util.descriptionModule: Contains utility commands (I really don't know how to explain this one)

rng.description: Returns a random number between two values.

arguments.lowerLimit: Lowest random number that can be chosen.
arguments.higherLimit: Highest random number that can be chosen.

help.description: Used to get information on the various commands available.

arguments.module: Otional. The name of the module to look for.
arguments.commande: Optional. The name of the specific command to look for.

emoji_search.description: Allows you to search an emoji by name, id or the emoji directly. Command raises an exception if an emoji is not found.

react_above.description: Adds a reaction to the latest message in the channel. THIS COMMAND DOES NOT RETURN ERROR MESSAGES.

arguments.<emoji>: The emoji to be added to the message. Works with animated emojis.

Dev.descriptionModule: Contains commands used for testing/development. Commands in this section are hidden and can only be used by the bot owner.

Moderation.descriptionModule: Contains commands to help with general server moderation tasks.

clear.description: Delete a certain amount of messages from the current channel. Requires permission to manage messages.

arguments.numberOfMessages: Optional. How many messages to delete. Defaults to 5. Max 99.

Marianne.descriptionModule: Contains commands to interact with Marianne on a more direct level.

join.description: Will let Marianne join your current voice channel.

ping.description: This command is used to test Marianne's ability to respond to your messages.

leave.description: Marianne will leave the voice channel she's in.

Tag.descriptionModule: This module contains commands to save pieces of text under a specific keyword (tags). User can see and summon their own tags, but not the ones of others.

tag set.description: Allows you to link a keyword to a text.
tag set.utilisation: m/tag set joke this is a really funny joke hahaha

arguments.tagName: The name under which you want to save the tag.
arguments.text: The text you want to save.

tag get.description: Allows you to show the text of a previously saved tag.

arguments.tagName: The name of the tag you previously saved.

tag mytags.description: Get a list of all your registered tags.

tag delete.description: Allows you to delete a previously registered tag.

arguments.tagName: The name of the tag to be deleted.

Enregistrement.descriptionModule: Contains several commands to save user data.

register discord.description: Allows Marianne to register your discord profile. This is necessary for all other profile linking.

register steam.description: Allows you to link your discord and steam profile.

arguments.autheticationCode: Optional. This is the code you will get after you login to steam.

whoami.description: This command will return information about your linked profiles.

Steam.descriptionModule: Contains commands to interact with steam. Some commands will require that you've registered your steam profile (see: register steam).

steam joinme.description: Returns a string formated as a Destiny 2 /join code: '/join [steamID]'

resources.description: Returns a link to the Sherpa Run google drive resource folder.

arguments.[arg]: Optional. A keyword for a specific folder.

Role.descriptionModule: Contains commands to manage many roles at once.

role remove_from_all.description: Removes the chosen role from every member on the server.

arguments.role: The role to be removed from all members.

role give_to_all.description: Gives the chosen role to every member on the server.

arguments.role: The role to be added to all members.

role get_count.description: Returns the number of members that have a certain role.

arguments.role: The role you're trying to get the count of.

role give_to_all_with_role.description: Every member that has roleA will be given roleB (users with that already have roleB will not be affected).

arguments.roleA: The role the member must already have.
arguments.roleB: The role the member will be given if he has roleA.

role remove_from_all_with_role.description: Every member with roleA will lose roleB (users that do not have roleB will not be affected).

role update_permissions_of_all.description: Sets the permission value of all roles to a certain value.

arguments.Permission value: The integer value of the permission. Use the following website to calculate permission values: https://discordapi.com/permissions.html
